Im Großen und Ganzen ein gelungenes Spiel.
Dennoch gibt's nennenswerte Mankos:
Was mich persönlich am meisten stört, ist das misslungene Balance für erfahrene/ Veteranspieler.
Soweit man sich in einem Rangbereich von Banane-Aubergine bewegt, kann man durchaus mit den verschiedenen Killern erfolgreich sein Objective erfüllen. Bewegt man sich nun in den "Highrank", gern betitelt als "Krücken-Rang", ist es alles andere als spaßig, als Wraith, Michael etc. pp. gegen vier, oftmals koordinierte Spieler zu spielen, die den Begriff "Wettrüsten" aus Zeiten des Kalten Krieges zu wörtlich genommen haben, anzutreten. Das Objective der Survivor ist zu stumpf, sich einen ein Objekt zu setzen, rechte Maustaste zu drücken und hier und da mal die Leertaste benutzen, ist viel zu einfach. Selbst ich Bob kriege es hin als Survivor in die roten Ränge zu kommen. Zudem werden Killer unnötig "benachteiligt" durch QoL-Updates (*hust* Nurse ). 
Zudem ist das allgemeine Mapdesign grottig, meines Erachtens zu RNG-lastig. So kann es vorkommen, dass auf bestimmten Maps , LT-Wall -> Jungle Jim -> LT-Wall spawnen kann, was den Killer zu viel Zeit kostet; Und Zeit hat der Killer so oder so nicht.
Trotzdem, Dead by Daylight ist für den Casual-Player lohnenswert, viele der Charaktere werden mit viel Liebe zum Detail geformt, rein texturentechnisch sind die Maps bezaubernt und die musikalische Untermalung ist top.

For the most part, I think the game itself is great.  It can get repetitive after awhile for both sides, whether you're playing a survivor and just holding M1 to repair generators or playing killer and having to chase survivors in circles too long, but overall games are full of fun and tense moments. At higher ranks and skill levels, survivors definitely know what they're doing well enough that it's not /really/ scary, but if you're a jumpy person and not playing to be the best, then you can still get that rush of trying to hide or run away from a killer.  Generally, the game is solid, the devs seem to still be very invested in not just fixing bugs and keeping the game running, but improving and changing things as time goes on with new content beyond just the DLC chapters of characters.  The updated maps are gorgeous, and for the most part have made a lot of the loops more fair, I think.  The Endgame Collapse was a great change, the Archives & the Tome are really interesting and, while some are a bit grindy, still good for getting more points to level up and getting some more lore if you're interested in their original characters, which are definitely the highlight of this game.  As cool as it is to have horror icons like Freddy Krueger and Michael Myers in the game (fingers crossed one day we still get Jason), their original designs for killers are easily some of the most fun and interesting ones to play.

A few negatives come to mind, gameplay-wise.  Currently at the time of this review, generators are definitely repaired too quickly, making certain killer perks almost a requirement to have a fair chance at winning.  Survive With Friends with outside communication is very strong, a fair number of survivor perks are basically just providing information that you wouldn't otherwise have, so people playing together over Discord can essentially play with 4 stronger perks while still having multiple other perks 'built in' by virtue of their ability to talk to each other and coordinate.

The main negative for me is less about the game itself though, as it is the playerbase.  I've never played a game with people that are not only incredibly toxic and rude, but think it's /perfectly fine/ to be that way.  I used to play a lot of League of Legends, and the joke was always how salty people got while playing that, but that's nothing compared to how people will BM you throughout a game and then continue the toxicity in the post-game chat, win OR lose.  It's incredibly frustrating to see it, especially when it keeps happening and you're just playing to do an in-game challenge, or trying out a new character/perks, or just playing to play.  It's not all players, some people just want to screw around too and have fun /with/ you rather than at your expense, which leads to some hilarious moments for everyone, but overall it feels like sportsmanship is very much lacking in this community.

I do recommend the game if you're a big fan of the slasher genre, if you've got friends to play with as a group, or enjoy the asymmetrical style of PvP.  Have fun, don't be toxic, we're all just trying to play a game here.

Edit: The game seems to be in a fairly good place right now, other than the matchmaking feeling rather unbalanced for both sides.  If they can adjust that to make matches less of "there's nothing I can do" or "I don't even have to try" then it'd be great.

Dead by Daylight is a 4v1 styled game. 4 survivors are trying to escape the 1 killer. The survivors have to repair generators and open an exit door to survive ,all while the killer is hunting them. Pretty simple game concept with a lot of replay value. 

Notes: 
1) DLC // with a game such as DBD not all of the killers + survivors will be top tier level. With that said invest in the DLC with some sales to save quite a few extra dollars, or be like me and buy every single one :) 

Pros:
1) Endless possibility of fun / better with friends
2) Unique combination of killers + survivors
3) Dedicated Servers 
4) Constant updates adding content

Cons: 
1) Hit boxes are a bit broken :)
2) the occasional bug may get in the way // nothing game breaking
 
Overall: 
DBD is a great game and should be experienced by fans of the horror genre. If you have a few friends round them up and give it a try in either the ranked modes or custom games! 
9/10

[b]Became my favorite multiplayer game in 10 hours.[/b]

The game is simple. Play as a survivor or the killer but be prepared for longer wait times if you pick the latter. It is a shame that the map selection is random. It doesn't appear that you are required to own a DLC pack to play the map it contains. I am unsure if the map is chosen from the killer's library or if the selection is truly random. DLC maps do appear to be chosen less often than the maps included in the base game.
 
As a survivor, you play as one of four. The aim is to collectively repair five generators that power two gates to escape through. The two gates then have to be activated to open. However, If only one survivor is left then they have the option of completing the original task or to find a trapdoor usually located near the border of the map. The trapdoor will emit an eery sound that both survivor and killer can hear if they approach it.

As the killer, the goal is to sacrifice all four survivors. This is achieved by hitting a survivor until they fall to the ground (two attempts for most killers). Once the survivor has fallen to the ground the killer can carry them to a hook. If left on the hook until the survivor's health is drained they will be sacrificed The Entity, however, the player can be rescued by a fellow survivor. The hooked survivor can escape themselves but only a 4% chance of doing so unless they have a perk to aid. Each time the survivor attempts to escape about 1/6 of their health is deducted. The survivor can usually attempt this three times before The Entity appears.

I would recommend this game to most people. It is built around a well-executed simple concept that can be enjoyed for a single game or played for hours using each character's upgrade system known as The Bloodweb, challenges, events and DLC content still being released. It is also nice that the game has flawless controller support for a Xbox controller. DS4Windows can sort the rest.

I am a highly skilled rank 3 Dead by Daylight (DbD) player. If you have played with me, you will know I am highly skilled and maybe one day you can achieve my greatness at this game Dead by Daylight (DbD).

As a professional at this game, Dead by Daylight (DbD), I only play it and nothing else, to make sure my skill level is at its best at all times.

If I am killer and facecamped you it is because of one of the following reasons:
You used flashlight in a toxic way (Blinded me)
You pallet stunned me when I picked up a survivor
You tea bagged against me
You cleansed my Devour Hope totem
You finished gen in front of me before I could grab you
You hook dived and your teammate got away because of Borrowed Time (BT)
You play Blendette
You rushed gen too fast

As a survivor, I WILL make sure you lose with my high skill if you:
Use Noone Escapes Death (NOED)
Stay within the hook more than ten seconds (I COUNT!!)
Camp a generator
Try to 3-gen the Survivors (survs)
Play the Blight
Play Wraith and uncloak while chasing
Hook someone in the basement as Leatherface
Use Iridescent Hatchets, Redhead's Pinkie Finger, Adrenaline Vial, Alchemist's Ring and Engineer's Fang
You play Ghostface and don't get revealed when I am looking at you (Hacker!!)
Find me when I am hiding even when I use Iron Will
If you go back to hook after someone is rescued (G-O F-O-R G-E-N-S NOOB)

If you stick to these very simple rules of conduct in Dead by Daylight (DbD), everyone will have much more fun and maybe one day you can become as skilled as me.

If you enjoy horror movies and playing first person games, then Dead by Daylight is worth trying.   I had played FPS and arena games, but the 4 vs 1 aspect of this game has made this game one of my favs.   

You decide in every game how altruistic or self-focused you will be as you progress in objectives, by repairing generators to ultimately unlock a gate, so that you may escape the killer.   Once open, you can go back to help other survivors or leave. 

This game provides the ability to mix and match preferred perks between killers and also survivors, which allows you to play a build that fits you best.  You can choose to play as your favorite killer or as one of the survivors.  A variety of survivor characters and killers (both movie notables and original) keep the game fresh and worth re-playing as you level up your skill and characters.   New killers/survivors are added to the game regularly, as DLC that you can buy if interested.  

The excellent killer you play against in one match may be on your survivor team in the next match.  Dead by Daylight is a great game to play with friends!
